main_definition: A month is a unit of time, typically consisting of around 30 or 31 days, that helps us measure the passage of time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Unit of time approximately equal to one-twelfth of a year
meanings_and_examples.example: My birthday is in August, which means it's halfway through my 12th month.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A calendar period used for recording and organizing events or tasks
meanings_and_examples.example: I have set a reminder for the first of each month to pay bills on time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The name given to specific periods, such as financial quarters in businesses
meanings_and_examples.example: Our company's fiscal year is divided into four months: January-March (Q1), April-June (Q2), July-September (Q3), and October-December (Q4).

meanings_and_examples.definition: A unit of measure in the agricultural industry, particularly for grains
meanings_and_examples.example: The farmer sold 10 tons of wheat at the market.
